description: How Spring Boot magically configures your app.

slides.title: The Magic ðŸª„
slides.content:
# Opinionated Defaults

Spring Boot looks at your classpath (libraries you added) and automatically configures beans for you.

Added `h2-database`? It configures an in-memory DB.
Added `spring-web`? It configures Tomcat and Spring MVC.

slides.title: @EnableAutoConfiguration
slides.content:
# The Switch ðŸ”›

This annotation (included in `@SpringBootApplication`) tells Spring Boot to start the auto-configuration process.

slides.title: Starters ðŸš€
slides.content:
# Dependency Bundles

`spring-boot-starter-web`

Includes all dependencies you need for a web app (Tomcat, Jackson, Validation).

Simplifies your `pom.xml` or `build.gradle`.

slides.title: Externalized Configuration
slides.content:
# properties vs yaml ðŸ“„

Settings are pulled from:
1. Command line args
2. Java System properties
3. `application.properties` (or `.yml`)
4. Environment variables

`server.port=8081`

slides.title: Profiles
slides.content:
# Environments ðŸŒ

Different settings for Dev, Test, and Prod.

`application-dev.properties`
`application-prod.properties`

Activate with `-Dspring.profiles.active=prod`.

slides.title: Config Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which file would Spring Boot load if the active profile is set to 'prod'?

slides.title: @Value
@ConfigurationProperties
slides.content:
# Type-Safe Config ðŸ›¡ï¸

Bind a group of properties to a POJO.

`app.mail.host`, `app.mail.port` -> `MailConfig` class.

Better than scattering `@Value` everywhere.

slides.title: Actuator
slides.content:
# Monitoring ðŸ©º

`spring-boot-starter-actuator`

Exposes endpoints to monitor your app:
- `/actuator/health`: System up/down.
- `/actuator/info`: Git commit info.
- `/actuator/metrics`: CPU, memory usage.

slides.title: Custom Starters
slides.content:
# Reusability ðŸ“¦

You can create your own starters! (e.g., `company-logging-starter`).

Encapsulates common company configurations and libraries to share across teams.

slides.title: Disabling Auto-Config
slides.content:
# Override ðŸ›‘

If auto-config gets in your way (e.g., you want your OWN DataSource, not the automatic one):

`@SpringBootApplication(exclude = { DataSourceAutoConfiguration.class })`

slides.title: Monitoring Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which Actuator endpoint specifically checks if the application is running?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Boot Magic âœ¨

Zero config setup.

- **Starters:** Dependencies.
- **AutoConfig:** Intelligent defaults.
- **Profiles:** Env specific.
- **Actuator:** Health checks.
